DOC.brief_summary: Gingival inflammation has been associated with cardiovascular diseases, including heart attack and stroke, because of elevation of blood risk markers such as cholesterol, glucose and C reactive protein. The treatment of gingival diseases decreases the concentration of these risk factors in the blood of cardiovascular patients.
DOC.brief_title: Periodontal Therapy in Coronary Artery Patients
DOC.criteria: 35 years and older coronary artery disease more than 10 teeth chronic periodontitis defined as 2 nonadjacent teeth with probing depth 5+mm and periodontal attachment loss 4+mm use of antibiotics in the last 6 months periodontal therapy in the last 12 months
